name: EMSAR
short_description:
EMSAR (Estimation by Mappability-based Segmentation And Reclustering) is a C program that estimates RNA abundances from RNA-seq data. It offers a superior or comparable accuracy and coverage over existing methods. EMSAR is an expansion of a previous work, NEUMA, which focuses on using mappability-corrected lengths for normalization. 

EMSAR clusters reads based on which transcript sequences to which they are mapped, and finds a length for every group as number of possible unique reads with the same transcript sharing. EMSAR uses reads that map to multiple genes as well as unique reads. EMSAR provides fast and memory-efficient computation.

Questions, bug reports and feature requests can either be emailed to duplexa@gmail.com or written to the forum under the 'Discussion' tab.
summary: Tool for quantifing RNA abundance from RNA-seq data.
